activities: Xerox Corporation (Xerox) receives, stores, and/or processes personal data from the EU regarding EU employees, customers, suppliers and vendors for business purposes involving the administration of employee benefits and services, human resources management, sales and marketing activities and supply chain management. The vast majority of information that Xerox receives is business contact information, human resources data, and customer, supplier, and vendor records. The personal data Xerox receives from the EU is used for evaluation of qualifications for work assignment, provision of employment benefits, reporting, security management, administration of compensation, performance management and training, budgeting and salary administration and workforce management, business contact directory, company network access, authentication and personalization and compliance with legal requirements,  environmental health and safety, order fulfillment and customer service and support.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
recoursemech: BBB EU Safe Harbor Participation for online and offline customer, supplier and vendor data. European Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs) for Human Resources Data.
